child.pub-comments: The author, on page 103, says Ju and !Ui-Taa "cannot be shown to be genetically related, but, nevertheless, share a number of linguistic features, some of which are fairly rare from a cross-linguistic point of view."
The author, on page 102, says this language is (presumably) extinct.

child.pub-comments: While maintaining that Kwadi is (presumably) extinct, the author is not sure of its classification. He also says Kwadi, together with Hadza and Sandawe, are language isolates of the Khoisan family.
child.publications: Güldemann, Tom & Rainer Vossen. 2000. Khoisan. In Bernd Heine & Derek Nurse (eds.), African Languages: An Introduction, 1 edn.ISBN 0521661781
